abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Assistance Special Financing
            Project for Serbia and Montenegro had the following ratings:
            the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development impact was substantial, and
            the Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            The lessons learned indicate that the Social Protection
            Economic Assistance Grant (SPEAG) is a prime example for the
            Bank flexibly responding to a Government which is pushing
            strongly for reforms in a narrow window of opportunity.
            Being based in Budapest at the time, the SPEAG Task Team
            Leader (TTL) of the project during preparation was able to
            effectively support the Government in the pursuit of its
            early and ambitious reform agenda in the areas of labor
            legislation and social welfare reforms. For a complex
            project with significant co-financing, ensure effective
            implementation arrangements and review if necessary. At the
            preparation stage, SPEAG was intended to disburse over a
            period of 12 months, in order to reap the benefit of the
            technical assistance in a timely manner. However, as became
            quickly apparent, this was overambitious: First, the
            complicated structure of the SPEAG with a number of
            co-financing grants spread across various Technical
            Assistance (TA) assignments. Second, the second Canadian
            grant came in only as late as early 2003, more than 12
            months into the project. Third, the absorptive capacity for
            TA in Serbia's Ministries was limited given the tall
            reform agenda faced by the key ministry staff. Lastly, the
            complex design did not help the overburdened Ministry staff
            as well as the Project Management Unit (PMU) in a system
            which already proved ill-suited to implement quickly.
